newsitem.title: SWEDEN: AGA will lower pace of investments - CEO.
newsitem.headline: AGA will lower pace of investments - CEO.

text.p: Swedish industrial and medical gas group AGA AB said on Monday it will lower the rate of investments in the future after some very intensive investment years.
"We expect that there will be a gradual downturn to 20 percent of turnover in 1998," AGA's chief executive officer Lennart Selander told Reuters.
AGA invested 2.9 billion crowns in new plants in 1996, which amounted to 23 percent of turnover. Selander sees the rate falling also after 1998.
"I would think that we will decrease it a bit further after 1998...16-17 percent is probably a more normal level," he said.
Earlier in the day, AGA posted a 17 percent fall in 1996 profit, excluding capital gains, to 1.76 billion crowns and 1996 sales of 12.86 billion crowns.
